meanings.definition: Offset or counterbalance (something) with an equal force.
meanings.sent1: She countervailed the weight of the box by adding more books to the other side.
meanings.sent2: The strong winds countervailed the efforts to keep the umbrella open.
meanings.sent3: The seesaw countervailed the weight of the two children perfectly, making them giggle.
meanings.sent4: Her determination countervailed the doubts in her mind, propelling her forward.
meanings.sent5: The tug-of-war match was intense, each team trying to countervail the other's strength.
